content:
You're welcome! It sounds like you have a solid plan in place to incorporate strength training into your fitness routine. Remember to be patient and consistent, and don't be afraid to adjust your plan as needed.

**Progressive Overload**: Gradually increasing the weight or resistance you're lifting is key to continued progress and improvement. Aim to increase the weight by 2.5-5lbs every two weeks, or as soon as you feel you can handle more.

**Proper Form and Technique**: Focus on proper form and technique over the number of reps or weight you're lifting. This will help you avoid injury and ensure you're targeting the correct muscles.

**Multiple Muscle Groups**: Exercises like squats, deadlifts, and lunges are great for targeting multiple muscle groups at once. This can help you save time and improve overall muscle balance.

**Recovery Time**: Allow your muscles time to recover between strength training sessions. This is when your muscles repair and rebuild, making you stronger.

**Balance Your Routine**: Don't forget to balance your strength training with cardio exercises like running and tennis, as well as flexibility exercises like stretching and yoga. This will help you maintain overall fitness and reduce the risk of injury.

**Listen to Your Body**: Pay attention to your body and take rest days as needed. It's better to take an extra day off than to risk injury by pushing through fatigue or pain.

Good luck on your fitness journey! Remember to stay consistent, patient, and kind to yourself. You got this!
